newsitem.title: USA: Apple unveils new operating system, hires search firm.
newsitem.headline: Apple unveils new operating system, hires search firm.

text.p: Apple Computer Inc. Tuesday introduced a new operating system for the Macintosh personal computer, the most significant Mac operating system upgrade since 1984.
Separately, Apple announced it hired Heidrick & Struggles Inc., an executive search firm, to help find a successor to former Chairman and Chief Executive Gilbert Amelio.
The troubled computer maker said it could take about 90 days to find a successor for Amelio, who stepped down earlier this month amid concerns that sales were not growing fast enough.
The Mac OS 8, a new version of the basic software that controls the Macintosh computer, is expected to generate much-needed revenues for Apple as Macintosh users upgrade their software.

Apple said in a statement that Mac OS 8 also represents the latest milestone in the company's dual strategy of delivering Mac OS updates as well as Rhapsody, the code name for Apple's next-generation operating system.
Mac OS 8 includes new features and technologies aimed at improving productivity and efficiency, simplifying Internet access and providing state-of-the-art multimedia capabilities.

"The depth of Internet capabilities in Mac OS 8, along with a dramatically improved user experience ... and industry-leading multimedia technologies will delight Macintosh customers," said Avie Tevanian, senior vice president for software engineering.

Included with Mac OS 8 are Netscape Navigator 3.01 and Microsoft Internet Explorer 3.01 for browsing the World Wide Web. It also uses the latest so-called push technologies, such as PointCast Network and Marimba's Castanet Tuner, which allow data to be sent to desktop machines without users having to search the Internet for it.

The PointCast Network in Mac OS 8 will include an Apple channel that notifies Mac users about breaking Apple-related news stories, software updates, new product announcements, customer support news, and other special information.
As a starting point for Internet exploration, Apple has collaborated with Web search firm Excite to provide data delivery and Internet navigation services in Mac OS 8.

Mac OS 8 is expected to be available in the United States and Canada on Saturday. The estimated retail price for Mac OS 8 in the United States is $99 for the CD-ROM version. Current Mac OS 7.6. or Mac OS 7.6.1 owners will be eligible for a $30 rebate, bringing the upgrade for those customers to $69.

Mac OS 8 will be made available for purchase on CD-ROM only, but customers may request a floppy disk version of Mac OS 8 after buying the CD-ROM version by returning a coupon included inside the box. Customers who want the diskette version will have to pay an additional $25 plus shipping, handling and sales tax.
